private_information: You focus on Scenario A (first statement and plan).
Do not invent actions, predicates, or objects beyond what is provided.
Summarize entities, predicates, action schemas, initial facts, goal facts, and the provided reference plan for Scenario A.
Your output should be an easy-to-parse structured summary, not PDDL.
analyst_1.goal: Extract and clarify all objects, predicates, action schemas, and the specific initial and goal facts for Scenario A; produce a clean, structured summary suitable for orchestration.

private_information: You focus on Scenario B (second statement).
Do not invent actions, predicates, or objects beyond what is provided.
Summarize entities, predicates, action schemas, initial facts, and goal facts for Scenario B; note that the human plan is not provided.
Your output should be an easy-to-parse structured summary, not PDDL.
analyst_2.goal: Extract and clarify all objects, predicates, action schemas, and the specific initial and goal facts for Scenario B; produce a clean, structured summary suitable for orchestration.

private_information: You are responsible for producing the final PDDL artifacts compatible with the Fast Downward planner.
Represent the six actions exactly as described: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
Use a single common domain for both scenarios and generate two separate problem files (one per scenario).
Keep predicate names and argument order exactly as specified; model them as predicates without types unless clearly required.
Prefer STRIPS-like add/delete lists and conjunctive goals for Fast Downward compatibility; avoid ADL features not necessary.
Ensure objects include every symbol referenced in each scenario’s facts and goals.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and two PDDL problem descriptions (Scenario A and Scenario B) that solve the described tasks with Fast Downward, preserving the given action semantics.

public_information: Action schema: paltry(o0, o1, o2). Preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2. Effects add: next o0 o2. Effects del: vase o0 o1.
Action schema: sip(o0, o1, o2). Preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2. Effects add: vase o0 o1. Effects del: next o0 o2.
Action schema: clip(o0, o1, o2). Preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2. Effects add: vase o0 o1. Effects del: next o0 o2.
Action schema: wretched(o0, o1, o2, o3). Preconditions: sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3. Effects add: next o0 o2. Effects del: next o0 o1.
Action schema: memory(o0, o1, o2). Preconditions: cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1. Effects add: next o0 o2. Effects del: next o0 o1.
Action schema: tightfisted(o0, o1, o2). Preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1. Effects add: next o0 o2. Effects del: vase o0 o1.

Scenario A initial facts: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_10 object_3, collect object_11 object_3, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_12, hand object_13, next object_0 object_9, next object_1 object_9, next object_12 object_11, next object_13 object_7, next object_4 object_8, next object_5 object_11, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_9, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_10, texture object_11, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Scenario A goal facts: next object_12 object_10, next object_13 object_9.

Scenario A human reference plan: clip object_12 object_5 object_11; wretched object_5 object_11 object_10 object_3; tightfisted object_12 object_5 object_10; wretched object_4 object_8 object_7 object_2; clip object_13 object_4 object_7; wretched object_4 object_7 object_6 object_2; tightfisted object_13 object_4 object_6; memory object_1 object_9 object_6; sip object_13 object_1 object_6; memory object_1 object_6 object_9; paltry object_13 object_1 object_9.

Scenario B initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, next object_0 object_8, next object_11 object_10, next object_12 object_6, next object_13 object_9, next object_3 object_7, next object_4 object_10, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Scenario B goal facts: next object_11 object_8, next object_12 object_8, next object_13 object_10.
Predicates used across scenarios: hand(x), cats(x), sneeze(x), spring(x), texture(x), stupendous(x), next(x y), vase(x y), collect(x y).

extraction.system_prompt: You are a precise knowledge extraction expert. From the provided public information and your private focus on Scenario A, produce a concise, machine-readable summary listing: objects; predicate inventory; action schemas with preconditions and add/delete effects; Scenario A initial facts; Scenario A goal facts; and the given human reference plan. Do not output PDDL; do not alter names or arities; keep terms exactly as written.
extraction.prompt: Your name is analyst_1. Use the environment public information to extract Scenario A details only and return a structured summary suitable for downstream planning integration. Include only items relevant to Scenario A and the shared action schema; avoid free-form prose. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Your knowledge: {agents->analyst_1->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->analyst_1->goal}.

extraction.system_prompt: You are a precise knowledge extraction expert. From the provided public information and your private focus on Scenario B, produce a concise, machine-readable summary listing: objects; predicate inventory; action schemas with preconditions and add/delete effects; Scenario B initial facts; and Scenario B goal facts. Do not output PDDL; do not alter names or arities; keep terms exactly as written.
extraction.prompt: Your name is analyst_2. Use the environment public information to extract Scenario B details only and return a structured summary suitable for downstream planning integration. Include only items relevant to Scenario B and the shared action schema; avoid free-form prose. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Your knowledge: {agents->analyst_2->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->analyst_2->goal}.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert multi-agent planner. Integrate the two summaries to produce one PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files, one per scenario, targeting the Fast Downward solver. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags, and each PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Requirements: use only features compatible with Fast Downward (strips, negative effects via delete lists; avoid conditional effects, quantified preconditions, or typing unless you include simple :typing and consistent types). Preserve exact predicate and action names and argument positions as given: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with their specified preconditions and add/delete effects. Ensure all objects referenced in each scenario are declared in the corresponding problem. For Scenario A, include the human reference plan as comments if desired but do not alter the domain semantics to force it. Output format: one <domain> block, then two <problem> blocks labeled for Scenario A and Scenario B.
pddl.prompt: Aggregate the extracted facts from the two analysts: {facts_1} and {facts_2}. Produce a single coherent PDDL domain capturing the six actions exactly as specified and two separate PDDL problem instances, one for Scenario A (using Scenario A initial facts and goal) and one for Scenario B (using Scenario B initial facts and goal). Ensure compatibility with the Fast Downward solver and avoid unsupported constructs.
